attributes.action: Get rid of the Downing Steet Petition System
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
After a few months of realisation, I have come to the conclusion that internet petitions have no politcal clout or holding whatsoever.

They seem to be a façade, giving the impression of interest, concern and acknowledgement from the government, while in practice they appear to have to sole function of keeping the webmaster in a job.

I either request that somebody proves the Downing Street E-Petition system has or is likely to make any feasible changes, or that the system is disposed of.

I am personally sick of going through the rigmarole of these petitions when it is blindingly obvious that the government take no notice of them. Notable examples being the 123 thousand people who signed the inheritance tax petition and the 56 thousand people who have already signed the Red Arrows petition.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
